alert.note: Alert for Natrona (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 05 at 4:51PM MDT until further notice by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall from thunderstorms is expected. * WHERE...South side of Casper Mountain, including Corral Creek and Clear Creek. * WHEN...Until 1045 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Small stream and creek flooding is possible due to heavy rainfall in short period of time. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 445 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Rapid river rises will likely cause flooding in the advisory area. Between 0.75 and 1.50 inches of rain have fallen, and rain continues at this time. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Corral Creek, Stinking Creek, Little Red Creek, Bates Creek, Pole Creek, Elkhorn Creek, Dry Creek, Muddy Creek, North Platte River, Pitchpine Creek, Clear Fork Muddy Creek, Beaver Creek, Bob Creek, Goose Creek, Otter Creek, Big Red Creek, Garden Creek and Coal Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... South side of Casper Mountain and nearby drainages.
info.instruction: In hilly terrain there are many low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become dangerous in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
